{"notifications":[{"id":7604,"message":"March 17, 2020 - Fowler School District R4J has made the difficult decision to utilize remote learning and close all of our school buildings through April 3, 2020. 

Academic Plan - Remote Learning:
We realize that this decision changes plans for the spring semester. Additional information will be shared on March 23.

Breakfast & Lunch - FREE
Fowler Schools is developing a plan to provide free meals to students. Families will be able to pick up breakfasts and lunches each day 7:30 – 9:00am in the drop-off lane at Fowler High School starting on March 23.

Buildings and Extra-Curricular Activities - CLOSED & CANCELLED
ALL district buildings, including schools and administrative offices, will be closed to the public, effectively immediately thru April 3, 2020, now April 17 as of March 18.. ALL extra-curricular activities scheduled during the dates of closure are cancelled. . We will keep the ‘Activity Calendars’ updated at www.fowler.k12.co.us.","type":"overlay"},{"id":7653,"message":"March 18, 2020 - Governor Polis issued an Executive Order requiring all Colorado schools to cease in-person instruction through April 17. This extends our Building closure through April 17.","type":"overlay"},{"id":7707,"message":"March 23, 2020 - Grab-n-Go lunches for ALL students at NO CHARGE begin in the FHS Drop Off Lane, 7:30-9:00am, will continue each weekday.","type":"overlay"},{"id":7785,"message":"March 25 - Based on the the Governor's Stay at Home order tonight, Thursday's Building Access has been CANCELLED. If your student has VITAL items at school, please EMAIL Mr. Bates or Mr. Lotrich to make arrangements.

We are allowed, AND WILL CONTINUE to provide Breakfast & Lunch every weekday morning (7:30-9:00am) for ALL KIDS 18 years and younger!!!

Student packets and work from teachers may continue to be picked up at the Breakfast & Lunch pick-up, but we may NOT accept or collect any work from students. As it is completed, please keep it at home until further direction is provided.","type":"overlay"},{"id":7923,"message":"April 1, 2020 - The Governor extended the suspension of in-person instruction through April 30.

We will continue to provide Remote Learning and Grab-n-Go lunches as we have since March 23.

We will provide additional information as we know it.","type":"overlay"},{"id":8084,"message":"April 20, 2020 - Fowler School District R4J reluctantly extended remote learning and closure of all of our buildings through the end of the school year. The Governor is also extending the suspension of In-Person Instruction through the end of the school year. We will continue to provide Grab-n-Go lunches & breakfasts as we have since March 23. Information related to graduation, athletics, locker/cubbie clean-out, etc. will be announced at a future date.","type":"overlay"}]}

div.div:
This page will provide up to date information regarding Fowler School District's response to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Call 719-263-4224 to reach the District Office if you need additional information.

div.div:
Beginning Monday, March 23, Free Student Breakfast & Lunch will be available to ALL STUDENTS in 'Grab & Go' fashion in the 'Drop-Off Lane' at Fowler High School (601 W. Grant Ave), 7:30-9:00am, Monday-Friday.
Cars should ENTER AT THE EAST END & follow the lane to the west. Everyone should remain in their cars. We will SERVE AT THE WEST END of the drop off lane.
Walk-ups will be served on the sidewalks near the west end of the Drop Off Lane.
Everyone is asked to exercise EXTREME CAUTION when in & around this area during the Grab & Go!

div.p: After much deliberation and discussion of how best to address the many needs of our students and staff members during this difficult time, Fowler School District R4J has made the difficult decision to utilize remote learning and close all of our school buildings through April 3, 2020. This was not an easy decision and it was not taken lightly. We know it will present challenges for our students, our staff, and many families, but feel that it is in the best interest of our entire community, state, and country to close our buildings, activities, and gatherings. Allowing for social distance during this time will help flatten the curve on COVID-19 cases and help prevent our health care facilities from being overwhelmed.

Please note that future recommendations from local, state, and federal health officials may cause us to close for even longer, so we strongly encourage families to plan for a longer closure, if needed. Please continue to check www.fowler.k12.co.us for updates as they become available.

We realize that this decision changes plans for the spring semester. We are currently working on plans for remote learning and we will share that information as soon as possible via SchoolRush, Facebook, and www.fowler.k12.co.us. Please expect additional information by March 23. Families who need internet can contact Spectrum at 1-844-488-8395 to set up free access for 60 days.

Fowler Schools is developing a plan to provide free meals to students. Families will be able to pick up breakfasts and lunches each day 7:30 9:00am in the drop-off lane at Fowler High School starting on March 23. We will provide information and updates as soon as possible via SchoolRush, Facebook, and www.fowler.k12.co.us.

ALL district buildings, including schools and administrative offices, will be closed to the public, effectively immediately thru April 3, 2020. ALL extra-curricular activities scheduled during the dates of closure are cancelled. We will make every effort to reschedule any cancelled activities as the ever-evolving situation allows. We will keep the Activity Calendars updated at www.fowler.k12.co.us.

Additionally, as of today, the Colorado High School Activities Association announced the extension of their suspension of spring sports through at least April 18 and the cancellation of several activities. The update can be found at https://chsaanow.com/2020-03-17/spring-sports-postponement-extended-to-april-18-hall-of-fame-music-events-cancelled/.

We are going to make our best efforts to make the best of this situation while prioritizing the health and well-being of our students, staff, community members and their families. We know that there are still a lot of questions. We are working hard to learn more and provide answers. We will continue our efforts to make sure you are as informed as possible via SchoolRush, Facebook, and www.fowler.k12.co.us. Please continue to check www.fowler.k12.co.us for more information as this situation continues to progress.
For district-specific questions, please contact me at 719-263-4224 or alfie.lotrich@fowler.k12.co.us. For COVID-19 questions, please contact the Otero County Health Department at 719-383-3040.
Thank you for your understanding and cooperation!

p.a: Website Hosting Solution Powered by SchoolBlocks

div.h3:
Welcome to the SchoolBlocks
self-guided tour!
div.p: The most common question we receive is, how is SchoolBlocks inspired by Pinterest? SchoolBlocks eliminates navigation bars and uses a block style layout thats similar to Pinterest. It creates a unique and engaging browsing experience, optimizes for mobile and removes a lot of navigational complexity.
Please click on the red plus signs found on this page to learn more about specific features.
